comment: Bertrand's postulate: there is a prime between ` N ` and ` 2 N ` for every positive integer ` N ` . This proof follows Erdős's method, for the most part, but with some refinements due to Shigenori Tochiori to save us some calculations of large primes. See ~ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proof_of_Bertrand%27s_postulate for an overview of the proof strategy. This is Metamath 100 proof #98. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Mar-2014.)
